meanings.definition: A device that produces electricity by chemical reactions
meanings.sent1: The batteries in my flashlight ran out, so I couldn't see in the dark.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to replace the batteries in the remote control when it stops working.
meanings.sent3: The batteries in the toy car were so tired, they decided to take a nap.
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like batteries, always charged and ready to go.
meanings.sent5: The batteries hummed with power, ready to light up the room.

meanings.definition: A set of guns or other heavy artillery
meanings.sent1: The soldiers carried heavy batteries up the hill for the battle.
meanings.sent2: The old fort displayed antique cannons and batteries along the walls.
meanings.sent3: The batteries of the warship were so loud, they woke up the seagulls.
meanings.sent4: The batteries of weapons stood ready, a silent threat in the night.
meanings.sent5: The batteries lined up like soldiers, waiting for the command to fire.

meanings.definition: The act of hitting someone or something repeatedly
meanings.sent1: The boxer's powerful batteries knocked out his opponent in the first round.
meanings.sent2: The battering ram's batteries struck the castle gates with force.
meanings.sent3: The batteries of raindrops tapped on the window, asking to come in.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like batteries, hitting him hard with each sentence.
meanings.sent5: The batteries of hail pounded the roof, creating a rhythmic drumming sound.
